text: hello hi everyone anthony boytano here
the internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for a review of
the new black thought album
streams of thought volume 3 kane and
abel this is the newest installment in
the streams of thought series
from legendary philly rapper black
thought a master spitter most
known as the lead mc in the group the
roots
he has been dropping some solo material
as of late which has come in the form of
some eps
both of which had some very impressive
moments on them and now the streams of
thought series has graduated into
album territory but just barely with
13 tracks which includes an intro an
outro
a few interludes too it all rounds out
at about 35 minutes
which isn't necessarily a bad thing
because anyone familiar with black
thoughts lyrical pedigree knows
he doesn't need a whole lot of time to
hit you with some mind-blowing lines
mostly what this project seems to
showcase are black thoughts be steel
flows and bars
just like the two previous streams of
thought volumes but there are some
notable attempts at working in unlikely
features
diversifying the instrumentals doing
some topical tracks and making it all
flow
like an album which is appreciated
because thought could easily drop an
encyclopedia of freestyles over 13
boombap beats
and it would get ate up he does dabble
in that a bit on one of the record's
kickoff state prisoner
which is a grimy and grand statement of
self packed with these sharp
free associative one-liners the
finishing bars on the track are hard as
hell too and bring the title full circle
a moment like this is fantastic from
black thought truly but it's also to be
expected
the the songs that felt a little more
refreshing or unexpected to me
were more hard hitting we have the utter
banger
good morning with a zany chorus from
swizz beatz plus top-notch appearances
from pusha t
and killer mike the beat is insane too
the sirens
the distorted bass the punchy snares
thematically
thought push and killer mike are all
kind of doing their own thing but they
each bring
great performances lots of energy lots
of
aggression and grit the chemistry is
absolutely there
then there's magnificent which is
another self-portrait of sorts but this
time we have a more nuanced beat
and bass line and lyrically black
thought is going further
down memory lane going from the early
90s where he's popping pills and
struggling to get his rhymes out there
too today
and the magnificence he's boasting about
certainly comes through
in his wordplay his monstrous tone and
flow
meanwhile there's quiet trip a more
tuneful number with a chorus from
portugal the man
which is one of a few tracks that
feature them oddly enough
the sound of this one's pretty tight too
those crispy drum beats the eccentric
vocal harmonies and those deeply pitched
refrains on the hook it sounds like
something out of an outcast song
this one follows through with a
narrative too black thought taking us
down memory lane to explain how violence
and drug dealing painted the days of his
youth
and like many second verses on this
thing he then contrasts the past with
the present now
sadly the project does take a bit of a
nose
dive past this point there's nature of
the beast which has black thought
singing which is not the first time he's
held the tune on record but this is far
from the
best example of that uh the track sounds
like a really bad
indietronic ballad with a mainstream rap
tie-in to uh
i i don't know uh it's it's
so off also those gag-inducing calls of
we
are we are on the the chorus i'm just
not into this at all this is easily the
worst track on the record by a few miles
and what's sad is that there's not a lot
of room on this record so
there's not really time for this the
following week could be good
is an improvement but it's still not one
of the better tracks here
lyrically it reads like a tedious
relationship on the rocks track that
doesn't really get to the heart of
anything
weirdly enough the takeaway seems to be
we could be
good but you keep complaining then
there's stakehom featuring schoolboy q
the production on this one is kind of
eerie textured feels like something you
would hear on a gerzelda project black
thought sounds relatively
cold-blooded on this one but it's not
one of his most impressive flows or
anything he reels it back but i don't
know if the
song is fireworks as a result of that
then schoolboy's appearance
is i think a little average for him i
guess he didn't need to do much more
than he did
but uh the chemistry on this one isn't
exactly off the charts
now i will say despite my issues with
some tracks around the middle of this lp
the ending is relatively strong thought
versus everybody is the most lyrically
dense moment on the entire record
one witty gem after another up
the game no condoms
also everything's obtuse nothing is
obscene another young life was lost on
live stream
the set of bars he drops about police
violence and
likening the life loss to that being
like a tree falling in the woods no one
seeing it
no one hearing it despite the iphone
footage covering it
overall the track is a fiery freestyle
that's been floating around for a little
bit
but now it's just fully realized on this
album the last full song on the project
is fuel which gets a great kick off from
the wonderful ghetto boys and girls
interlude that flows into it very nicely
instrumentally
portugal the man gets one more hook in
here too and lyrically i guess this is
one of the more emotional
and introspective moments on the lp2 a
lot of stress and anguish coming through
in black thoughts bars
also expressing regrets over burning
bridges
and issues he's had in relationships
with friends and family he finishes the
track off with a lot of things
including i guess wondering or uh
sort of being suspect of the future of
people of color in
america given the country's very spotty
or horrendous past on racial justice
overall though i'd say streams of
thought was pretty good didn't
necessarily blow the previous eps out of
the water
as there were some underwhelming and
disappointing moments around the
midpoint of the lp
while thot's lyrical ability still
remains unmatched by most there were
some shortcomings exposed
during the moments he tried to branch
out of that feeling a light to decent
seven
on this one tran position have you given
this album a listen did you love it did
you hate it what would you rate it
you're the best you're the best what
should i review next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video for you to check out
hit that up or the link to subscribe to
the channel anthony fantano
black thought forever
